structure.unit: AGRICULTURAL SEEDS, FEEDING STUFFS, AND FERTILIZERS

law.text: The director may issue and enforce a written or printed "stop sale, use, or removal" order to the owner or custodian of any lot of fertilizer and to hold it at a designated place, when the director finds said fertilizer is being offered or exposed for sale in violation of any of the provisions of KRS 250.371 to 250.451, until the law has been complied with and said fertilizer is released in writing by the director, or said violation has been otherwise legally disposed of by written authority. The director shall release the fertilizer so withdrawn when the requirements of the provisions of KRS 250.371 to 250.451 have been complied with and all costs and expenses incurred in connection with the withdrawal have been paid.
law.history: Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 191, sec. 16, effective July 13, 1984.
